description: From Middle English curteis, from Old French curteis (French courtois), from cort (“court”).

adjectives.description: courteous (comparative more courteous, superlative most courteous)

entries.meaning: Showing regard or thought for others; especially, displaying good manners or etiquette.
examples: Antonyms: discourteous, uncourteous; see also Thesaurus:impolite
a courteous gentleman   a courteous gesture
